reviews.text: I was recommended this hotel in Tauranga for its fantastic position close to town centre, and it could not have been more perfectly positioned - great restaurants within walking distance, room wth a view of the water and Mount, spacious spa bath, flat screen TV, and excellent staff. The decor is understated and elegant. Perfect attention to detail.Lovely shopping in the vicinity. Would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: A wonderful boutique hotel, with fine attention to detail

likes.liked: — Great attention to detail, good decor, spacious and welcoming

reviews.text: Hotel is right in the main street of Tauranga but is very quiet. I was there for business and could walk everywhere. Very secure hotel with small lobby at the front entrance and swipe card car garage at the rear. Staff were welcoming and friendly and their service throughout my 2 day staff was excellent. Room was very modern with lovely bathroom, consisting of wash basin, toilet and shower. Plenty of fresh thick towels, soaps, shampoos etc were provided and bathroom was immaculately clean. Main room had a couch, kingsize bed (with lovely linen), built in desk area with internet access, chairs and a tv. TV was about 21inch old style television which I think let down the rest of the rooms modern feel but it worked well and had all the major TV channels and Sky. There were built in wardrobes, minibar, toaster, microwave, jug etc behind mirrored doors. There was a very small deck through a door/window but this is why I rated this hotel above average rather than excellent as my room overlooked a grotty back alley. Curtains shut that view out nicely but as the hotel was no where near full I felt they could have given me an ocean view - my advice ask for ocean view. I had room service for each breakfast/dinner and this was all fine.
reviews.title: Modern and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Great location you are right in the centre making it easy to walk everywhere. Good value for $150.00 NZ per night including a cooked breakfast for two. Room nicely decorated with modern amenities and was a good sized room. Bathroom spotless. Would stay here again for sure. Reception staff very friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — Rooms very modern and very clean

reviews.title: Nice!
reviews.text: loved our stay here
room was really nice a little small but really nice
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't really want to give this hotel a great review in case I can't get a booking the next time I book into it LOL
reviews.title: Glamorous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrible start to our holiday staying up in Paihia, our hotel was awful!
reviews.title: So good we stayed an extra night in the area

likes.liked: — Comfort of the bed and cleanliness of bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel on Devonport was our second holiday destination. I fell in love the moment I walked into the room.
reviews.title: Loved the decor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, spacious, modern and classy. And this was there standard room. We were even delivered a glass of wine, a beer for the hubby and a pkt of potato chips to our room... lovely welcoming gesture.
reviews.title: Best bed ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm quite fussy with bathrooms...Devonport's was immaculate! After the long drive from Paihia and depressing hotel experience, I needed shopping therapy - I got everything I needed on that same road of the hotel. Lovely shops, all walking distances. Even had dinner on the same road.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed as a family at this hotel and found it to be new, clean and friendly. I would say its aimed at business travelers or more upmarket clients and with this in mind its strange it did not have a restaurant.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Business Class Hotel

reviews.text: It is on right in the center of town and there are plenty of places to eat with a few minutes walk. However we nearly ended up with no food when all the restaurants started closing quite early. It was a Sunday so that might have been the reason.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel and area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Car parking was at the rear of the hotel and seemed secure.
reviews.title: Great Contempory Hotel

reviews.text: The room, well more a small suite, had a lounge with a pull out bed, good size bathroom with jacuzzi and separate shower. The bedroom was of a good size.
reviews.title: Fresh Modern Hotel

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel a couple of days after christmas and were very surprised at how centerally located the hotel was. It is right in the middle of all the shops, cafes, and night life. The only thing you have to drive to is the beach. The service was great. When we arrived we were treated to beer, wine, or soda plus snacks. We then went to head to the beach and they had beach towels for us. The rooms were very large by any standards and the bathrooms had great extras like heated towel racks and great soaps and shampoos. All in all I loved the place and wish I could have stayed longer. We were a party of 9 and were all very happy with our rooms.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a fantastic hotel. The room was large and very modern and the bathroom was a good size. The only downside was that there wasn't a restaurant in the hotel and Taurangna is not a great place to go out for a meal on a Sunday night as nothing is open. We did get a nice meal at the italian place just over the street. Breakfast the next day we had in a cafe down the street.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: I would definately recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Perfect - everything the discerning traveller could want

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't fault this Hotel - have stayed here on Two occasions. Once for a Personal Birthday celebration and once again for a Business trip. We have experienced the Superior rooms with City Views and the Superior room with Sea Views - personally I would recommend spending a little extra for the great view of sunset over the Harbour Bridge! Loved the Free drinks on arrival, the complimentary apples in the lobby, and most of all the lovely staff who can never do too much to help. 10/10
reviews.title: Good clean rooms, centrally located, good secure parking. Highly reccomend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at the Hotel on Devonport was a really pleasant experience, thank you to other reviewers for pointing the way. Reception were very welcoming and the rooms were as described, spacious and clean with an excellent bathroom. The hotel does not own the bar, so it is worth checking what time they plan to close. There are plenty of bars and Restaurants around the hotel, so a nightcap is not a problem if you need one.
reviews.title: Clean, modern and optimally located

reviews.text: Also if you order breakfast it is brought to your room. We ate at Cafe Med , just 3/4 doors away and had a great breakfast surrounded by locals. Loved it.
reviews.title: Very Very Nice
